00019 void Layer::Load(std::ifstream& data, Resource_manager& resource_manager)
00020 {
00021         //Todo: Make sure loading works, on all platforms.
00022         Attributes attributes;
00023 
00024         std::string line;
00025         while (seek_non_comment_line(data, line))
00026         {
00027                 if ("</layer>" == line)
00028                 {
00029                         /* Used to only need to type attribute name once: prevents typos */
00030                         std::string attributeName;
00031 
00032                         attributeName = "tilemap";
00033                         if (attributes.end() != attributes.find(attributeName))
00034                         {
00035                                 Show_attributes(std::cout, attributes);
00036 
00037                                 //Todo: Tileset should be loaded with resource manager
00038                                 Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL2, std::cout, "Layer:Load()\n\tfile: \"%s\"\n", attributes[attributeName].c_str());
00039                                 tileset.Set_Dimensions(tile_w, tile_h);
00040                                 tileset.Load(attributes[attributeName], resource_manager);
00041                                 attributes.erase(attributeName);
00042                         }
00043 
00044                         if (attributes.end() != attributes.find("width") && attributes.end() != attributes.find("height"))
00045                         {
00046                                 Show_attributes(std::cout, attributes);
00047 
00048                                 /* Read in [row x column] points if both height and width are
00049                                  * specified.
00050                                  *
00051                                  * If one or the other is not defined, do nothing.
00052                                  */
00053                                 attributeName = "width";
00054                                 int width = String_to_type<int>(attributes[attributeName]);
00055                                 attributes.erase(attributeName);
00056 
00057                                 attributeName = "height";
00058                                 int height = String_to_type<int>(attributes[attributeName]);
00059                                 attributes.erase(attributeName);
00060 
00061                                 tilemap.resize(width);
00062                                 for (int y = 0; y < height; ++y)
00063                                 {
00064                                         /* Convert the current row into a number.  Then find the
00065                                          * "0 = ..." pair using that number/index.
00066                                          */
00067                                         std::stringstream row;
00068                                         row << y;
00069                                         if (attributes.end() != attributes.find(row.str()))
00070                                         {
00071                                                 // Pull in the entire string value to a stream
00072                                                 std::stringstream col(attributes[row.str()]);
00073                                                 for (Tilemap::iterator c = tilemap.begin(); c < tilemap.end(); ++c)
00074                                                 {
00075                                                         int index;
00076                                                         col >> index;
00077                                                         c->push_back(Tile(index));
00078                                                 }
00079                                         }
00080                                 }
00081                         }
00082 
00083                         // Once the closing tag is found, do not scan the file any further.
00084                         break;
00085                 }
00086 
00087                 //Store name, value pair in attributes
00088                 std::string name;
00089                 std::vector<std::string> value;
00090 
00091                 /* Ensure that the line has a valid "name=value" pair, else we will
00092                  * see problems.
00093                  */
00094                 if (true == name_and_value(line, name, value))
00095                 {
00096                         /* Until we figure out how to have multiple values with the same
00097                          * name, we're only going to be able to take the first one...
00098                          */
00099                         attributes[name] = value[0];
00100                 }
00101         }
00102 }

00105 void Layer::Render(const Camera& camera)
00106 {
00107         Vector cam_apply = camera.Apply(Vector(0, 0));
00108         float cam_apply_x = cam_apply.X();
00109         float cam_apply_y = cam_apply.Y();
00110 
00111         int cols = static_cast<int>(tilemap.size());
00112         for (int x = 0; x < cols; ++x)
00113         {
00114                 int rows = static_cast<int>(tilemap[x].size());
00115                 for (int y = 0; y < rows; ++y)
00116                 {
00117                         tileset.Render(tilemap[x][y], x * tile_w + cam_apply_x, y * tile_h + cam_apply_y);
00118                 }
00119         }
00120 }
